data.title: Purple Line Metro Bangalore: Stations, Map, Timing & Route 2024
data.meta_description: Discover the transformative impact of the Purple Line Metro Bangalore, connecting key areas, improving accessibility, and revolutionising commuting.
data.text:
Introducing the Purple Line Metro in Bangalore, an affordable, speedy, and user-friendly addition that promises to revolutionise the city's transportation system. Opening its doors in early October, this 43-kilometre marvel effortlessly connects Whitefield to Challaghatta, ensuring a seamless commute for countless passengers. What sets it apart is the decision to unveil the entire line at once, strategically reducing traffic disruptions and ensuring an efficient travel experience. Let's take an in-depth look at what Bangalore Metro’s Purple line has to offer.

What Stations are on the Metro Purple Line? Bangalore Metro Purple Line Map

The Bangalore Purple Line Metro is a 45-kilometre line that will connect Whitefield to Challaghatta. The line is expected to open in early October 2023 and will expand the metro network to over 73 km.

Here is a detailed description of the stations on the Purple Line:

Terminal stations

Whitefield metro route (Kadugodi) is the western terminus of the line. It is located in the Whitefield IT hub and is expected to be a major commuter station.

Challaghatta is the eastern terminus of the line. It is located on the outskirts of Bengaluru and is expected to serve commuters from the surrounding areas.

Major stations

Byappanahalli is a major interchange station that connects the Purple Line to the Green Line and the Yellow Line. It is located in the heart of Bengaluru and is expected to be a busy station.

KR Pura is another major interchange station that connects the Purple Line to the Yellow Line. It is located in the KR Pura industrial area and is expected to serve commuters from the surrounding areas.

Kengeri is a major station that is located in the Kengeri satellite town. It is expected to serve commuters from the surrounding areas.

Intersection stations

Byappanahalli is an intersection with the Green Line and the Yellow Line.

KR Pura is an intersection with the Yellow Line.

Other stations

The Purple Line also includes a number of other stations, including:

Indiranagar is a major station that is located in the Indiranagar IT hub.

MG Road is a major station that is located in the heart of Bengaluru.

Cubbon Park is a major station that is located near Cubbon Park, a popular tourist destination.

Vidhana Soudha is a major station that is located near the Vidhana Soudha, the seat of the Karnataka state government.

Mysuru Road is a major station that is located near the Mysuru Road railway station, a major railway junction.

The opening of the Purple Line is expected to provide a much-needed boost to public transportation in Bengaluru. The line will connect two of the city's major economic hubs, Whitefield and Kengeri, and will make it easier for commuters to travel between the two areas.

The Purple Line constitutes an integral part of Namma Metro, the rapid transit system serving the city of Bangalore, India. It consists of 37 active stations of the Namma Metro network and is operated by Namma Metro Bangalore.

Here is a complete list of all the stations on the Purple Line:

The Purple Line Metro in Bangalore spans the bustling Whitefield (Kadugodi) station to the serene terminus of Challaghatta. In just 1 hour and 22 minutes and at a fare of just 55 rupees, this metro line weaves through the heart of the city, offering you an unparalleled experience of convenience and connectivity.

Bangalore Metro Purple Line Timings

The full Purple Line metro in Bangalore has yet to become fully operational. Presently, several stations are still in construction as part of Phase II. The operational Whitefield metro timings: the trains run daily from 5:00 AM to 11:00 PM, arriving at intervals of 5-7 minutes.

However, in Bangalore metro timings purple line on Sundays, there is a slight variation in operating hours. Every Sunday, metro timings in Bangalore (purple line) are 7:00 AM to 10:40 PM, typically with a waiting time of 8-10 minutes between trains. Train frequency may differ during off-peak and peak hours.

Purple Line Metro Fare

In Bangalore, the metro service stands out as the most convenient and cost-effective mode of transportation. The minimum fare for stations completed in Phase I is Rs 10, while the maximum fare reaches Rs 17.

Here's a table displaying the varied fares for stations along the Purple Line metro.

In Bangalore, if you use the metro often, you have the option to buy a Smart Card directly from an authorised outlet. To obtain this card, a security deposit is required. Afterwards, the card remains valid for 30 days or until your pre-loaded cash runs out, whichever comes first.

In a bid to make metro travel in Bengaluru even more convenient, the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Ltd (BMRCL) has introduced QR ticketing on WhatsApp. This innovative service allows Namma Metro passengers to skip the long queues and access various metro-related services right from their WhatsApp chat.

How to Purchase QR Tickets on WhatsApp:

Here are the steps to buy QR tickets using WhatsApp:

Step 1: Open WhatsApp and send 'hi' to +91 81055 56677.

Step 2: Click on the QR Tickets option.

Step 3: Choose to buy a ticket, cancel a ticket, or check recent journeys.

Step 4: Enter your starting station for the journey by either sharing your location or typing the station name.

Step 5: Select your preferred route: Green Line or Purple Line.

Step 6: Choose your destination station.

Step 7: Review the booking details and click to proceed.

Step 8: Make the payment via WhatsApp Pay or other online payment methods.

Once the payment is successful, your QR ticket will appear on the screen, ready to be scanned at the metro station's entry and exit gates.

This new service also offers the convenience of checking transit timetables and updated fare tables. It's an excellent way to simplify your metro travel experience in Bengaluru.

If you're interested in exploring more budget-friendly options, consider reading our blog on the cheapest places to live in Bangalore.

Latest News Updates on Bangalore Metro Purple Line Extension

In recent news, the Purple Line Metro extension is generating excitement. With the Kengeri – Challaghatta and KR Puram – Baiyappanahalli stretches scheduled to open after September 15, this expansion will link East Bangalore to various city sectors, greatly enhancing accessibility. The dedicated efforts of the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) have expedited inspections, promising tech professionals in areas like Mahadevapura, ITPB, and Kadugodi a smoother daily commute.

Metro Service Expansion

The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) is launching additional train services on the Purple Line, focusing on the stretch between Mahatma Gandhi Road and Nadaprabhu Kempegowda Majestic metro stations. This move, beginning today, addresses the high weekday commuter demand. Expansion is to cover other metro lines is in the pipeline, with passengers advised to transfer at MG Road station if heading to Baiyappanahalli.

Network Growth Considerations

Bangalore Metro authorities are contemplating an expansion of the Metro Network to encompass four outlying towns: Doddaballapur, Nelamangala, Devanahalli, and Hoskote. This strategic enlargement aims to enhance citywide connectivity and reduce traffic congestion. Notably, a 6-km Purple Line extension will link Hoskote to Whitefield.

Integrated Iblur Station Project

BMRCL is embarking on a project to construct an integrated metro station at Iblur, catering to two metro lines: Phase 2A (Outer Ring Route: Central Silk Board to KR Puram) and Phase 3A (Sarjapur and Hebbal). This consolidated station will simplify commuting for Outer Ring Road (ORR) travelers accessing key commercial areas, including Town Hall, Central College, and Cunningham Road.

KR Puram Metro Station Enhancement

A significant development underway is the construction of a foot over-bridge (FOB) linking KR Puram railway station and the Metro station. The South Western Railway (SWR) and BMRCL have reached an agreement regarding land acquisition conditions, marking progress toward a more interconnected transportation system. The FOB project, divided into three phases, will enhance connectivity for Purple Line and Blue Line stations and improve access to all Namma Metro stations from the renovated KR Puram railway platform.

Fare Restructuring

August 2023 brought announcements of plans for a new fare structure for the Purple Line Metro, expected to be distance-based. Additionally, the BMRCL is set to introduce new travel passes for the Purple Line Metro.

Last-Mile Connectivity

The Outer Ring Road Companies Association (ORRCA) has urged businesses and tech parks along the Outer Ring Road (ORR) in Bengaluru to provide shuttle services for their employees to the nearest metro station. This proactive approach anticipates the operationalisation of the Byappanahalli-KR Pura Namma Metro link in the first week of October, emphasising the importance of last-mile connectivity.

Upcoming Purple Line Milestones

The Purple Line is poised for significant milestones, with its full operationalisation expected by September 15, 2023. This development will connect east Bengaluru to various city sectors, substantially enhancing public transportation. Additionally, the extension between Baiyappanahalli and Krishnarajapura (KR Puram) stations is undergoing final inspection, with the missing link set to open by late September, greatly easing travel to and from Whitefield.

Residential Areas Near These Stations

The Bangalore Metro Purple Line is poised to offer improved connectivity for commuters heading to Whitefield, a prominent hub housing numerous tech parks. Furthermore, it is expected to catalyze real estate growth in more budget-friendly areas of the city like Challaghatta and Kengeri.

To delve deeper into promising investment opportunities in Bangalore, don't miss our blog on the best places to invest in Bangalore.

Below is the list of major residential neighborhoods around Purple Line metro Bangalore:

1. Rajarajeshwari Nagar

Rajarajeshwari Nagar, with property prices averaging around Rs 6,300 per sq ft, has exhibited a commendable 6 percent capital appreciation in recent times. This locality is known for its affordability and provides 2 BHK units for rent, typically ranging from Rs. 13,200 to 17,600 per month.

Its competitive property rates and decent rental options make it an attractive choice for budget-conscious home buyers and tenants. Additionally, Rajarajeshwari Nagar benefits from its location along the Purple Metro Line, ensuring good connectivity and accessibility to other parts of the city.

2. Shivaji Nagar

Shivaji Nagar, with property rates around Rs 11,300 per sq ft, offers a diverse range of housing options to cater to various preferences. While specific rental values for Shivaji Nagar are not provided in the data, this locality is known for its central location and accessibility to key commercial areas. It attracts residents looking for the convenience of city living and easy connectivity to business districts.

With its vibrant marketplaces and cultural diversity, Shivaji Nagar also appeals to those who relish the rich tapestry of urban life. Additionally, the proximity to educational institutions, healthcare facilities, and entertainment hubs adds to the allure of this locality, making it an enticing choice for both residents and investors.

3. Vijayanagar

Vijayanagar, with property rates averaging Rs 8,300 per sq ft, has witnessed modest 1.3 percent capital appreciation. It offers 2 BHK units for rent, with monthly rates typically falling in the range of Rs. 15,600 to 17,600. This locality is known for its peaceful residential environment and proximity to essential amenities, making it a favoured choice for families and working professionals. With its well-maintained infrastructure and reasonable property prices, Vijayanagar provides a balanced and convenient living experience for its residents.

4. Ulsoor

Ulsoor, located in central Bangalore, is a densely populated residential area known for narrow lanes and an abundance of mid-sized 2 BHK and 3 BHK independent houses. Property rates in Ulsoor have experienced a significant 13 percent capital appreciation over the last six months, reaching an average of Rs 13,100 per sq ft as of January 2022, due to ongoing development initiatives under the Bangalore Smart City Mission.

Ulsoor's strategic proximity to key employment hubs like Bagmane Tech Park and International Tech Park, located just 4-6 km away, has heightened the demand for housing in the area, with the nearest metro station, Halasuru, conveniently situated within a walkable distance of 650 metres, offering residents easy access to public transportation.

5. Frazer Town

Frazer Town, strategically located in the heart of Bangalore, is a highly sought-after residential hub known for its excellent connectivity and diverse housing options. Situated about 4 km from Cubbon Park Metro Station on the Purple Line, this locality offers seamless access to corporate areas like MG Road, Shivaji Nagar, and Infantry Road, making it ideal for professionals.

Property prices in Frazer Town average around Rs 9,200 per sq ft, more budget-friendly than neighbouring Richmond Town, where rates can soar to Rs 14,000 per sq ft. Prime roads like Promenade Road, Netaji Road, and Madhavaraya Mudaliar Road provide quick connectivity to institutions like Dr. BR Ambedkar Medical College, ICFAI, and Peenya Industrial Area.

For those seeking a touch of luxury, check out our blog highlighting the top 10 posh areas in Bangalore.

In conclusion, the Purple Line Metro in Bangalore has ushered in a new era of convenient and efficient commuting for residents and professionals alike. With its extensive network and upcoming expansions, it promises seamless connectivity to key areas across the city.
